title: Conditional event algebra
summary: A standard, Boolean algebra of events is a set of events related to one another by the familiar operations and, or, and not. A conditional event algebra (CEA) contains not just ordinary events but also conditional events, which have the form "if A, then B". The usual purpose of a CEA is to enable the defining of a probability function, P, that satisfies the equation P(if A then B) = P(A and B) / P(A).
